actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Governmental Affairs.
Referred to Subcommittee on Civil Service and General Services.
Committee on Governmental Affairs requested executive comment from U.S. Postal Service.
Subcommittee on Civil Service and General Services. Approved for full committee consideration without amendment favorably.
Committee on Governmental Affairs. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.
Committee on Governmental Affairs. Reported to Senate by Senator Roth without amendment. Without written report.
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 935.
Passed Senate without amendment by Voice Vote.

actions.committee: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service.
House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service Discharged by Unanimous Consent.
Called up by House by Unanimous Consent.
Message on House action received in Senate and held at desk: House amendments to Senate bill.
Senate agreed to the House amendment by Voice Vote.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Civil Service, Post Office, and General Services

committees.committee: House Post Office and Civil Service

official_title: A bill to designate the United States Post Office to be constructed in Barnwell, South Carolina, as the "Solomon Blatt, Sr., Post Office Building".

summary.text: (Measure passed House, amended) Designates certain postal facilities as follows: (1) the Post Office to be constructed on Main Street, Barnwell, South Carolina, as the Solomon Blatt, Sr., Post Office Building; (2) the building on North Kings Highway, St. Louis, Missouri, as the Frederick N. Weathers station of the United States Postal Service; (3) the Post Office on Main Street, Flushing, New York, as the Benjamin S. Rosenthal Post Office Building; (4) the building to be constructed at Florida and Central Avenues, Los Angeles, California, as the Leslie Nelson Shaw, Sr., General Mail Facility of the United States Postal Service; (5) the building located at 2909 Rogerdale, Houston, Texas, as the Debra Sue Schatz Post Office Building; (6) the building at East Second Street and Chester Avenue, Moorestown, New Jersey, as the Edwin B. Forsythe Post Office Building; (7) the building located on South Ervay, Dallas, Texas, as the Juanita Craft Post Office of South Dallas; and (8) the building being constructed at Belle Terre Boulevard, La Place, Louisiana, as the Gillis W. Long Post Office Building.

titles.title: A bill to designate the United States Post Office to be constructed in Barnwell, South Carolina, as the "Solomon Blatt, Sr., Post Office Building".
